intro: Bellevalia mathewii, commonly known as the Mathew's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high altitudes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
